wb:indicator.wb:name: Net income from abroad (current US$)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net income includes the net labor income and net property and entrepreneurial income components of the SNA. Labor income covers compensation of employees paid to nonresident workers. Property and entrepreneurial income covers investment income from the ownership of foreign financial claims (interest, dividends, rent, etc.) and nonfinancial property income (patents, copyrights, etc.). Data are in current U.S. dollars.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net income from abroad (current LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net income includes the net labor income and net property and entrepreneurial income components of the SNA. Labor income covers compensation of employees paid to nonresident workers. Property and entrepreneurial income covers investment income from the ownership of foreign financial claims (interest, dividends, rent, etc.) and nonfinancial property income (patents, copyrights, etc.). Data are in current local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net income from abroad (constant LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net income includes the net labor income and net property and entrepreneurial income components of the SNA. Labor income covers compensation of employees paid to nonresident workers. Property and entrepreneurial income covers investment income from the ownership of foreign financial claims (interest, dividends, rent, etc.) and nonfinancial property income (patents, copyrights, etc.). Data are in constant local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Indirect taxes (current US$)
Indirect taxes (current LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net taxes on products (current US$)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net taxes on products (net indirect taxes) are the sum of product taxes less subsidies. Product taxes are those taxes payable by producers that relate to the production, sale, purchase or use of the goods and services. Subsidies are grants on the current account made by general government to private enterprises and unincorporated public enterprises. The grants may take the form of payments to ensure a guaranteed price or to enable maintenance of prices of goods and services below costs of production, and other forms of assistance to producers. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net taxes on products (current LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net taxes on products (net indirect taxes) are the sum of product taxes less subsidies. Product taxes are those taxes payable by producers that relate to the production, sale, purchase or use of the goods and services. Subsidies are grants on the current account made by general government to private enterprises and unincorporated public enterprises. The grants may take the form of payments to ensure a guaranteed price or to enable maintenance of prices of goods and services below costs of production, and other forms of assistance to producers. Data are in current local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net taxes on products (constant LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net taxes on products (net indirect taxes) are the sum of product taxes less subsidies. Product taxes are those taxes payable by producers that relate to the production, sale, purchase or use of the goods and services. Subsidies are grants on the current account made by general government to private enterprises and unincorporated public enterprises. The grants may take the form of payments to ensure a guaranteed price or to enable maintenance of prices of goods and services below costs of production, and other forms of assistance to producers. Data are in constant local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Subsidies (current US$)
Subsidies (current LCU; from SNA)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net current transfers from abroad (current US$)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Current transfers comprise transfers of income between residents of the reporting country and the rest of the world that carry no provisions for repayment. Net current transfers from abroad is equal to the unrequited transfers of income from nonresidents to residents minus the unrequited transfers from residents to nonresidents. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net current transfers from abroad (current LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Current transfers comprise transfers of income between residents of the reporting country and the rest of the world that carry no provisions for repayment. Net current transfers from abroad is equal to the unrequited transfers of income from nonresidents to residents minus the unrequited transfers from residents to nonresidents. Data are in current local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net current transfers from abroad (constant LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Current transfers comprise transfers of income between residents of the reporting country and the rest of the world that carry no provisions for repayment. Net current transfers from abroad is equal to the unrequited transfers of income from nonresidents to residents minus the unrequited transfers from residents to nonresidents. Data are in constant local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Terms of trade adjustment (constant LCU)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: The terms of trade effect equals capacity to import less exports of goods and services in constant prices. Data are in constant local currency.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

wb:indicator.wb:name: DEC alternative conversion factor (LCU per US$)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: The DEC alternative conversion factor is the underlying annual exchange rate used for the World Bank Atlas method. As a rule, it is the official exchange rate reported in the IMF's International Financial Statistics (line rf). Exceptions arise where further refinements are made by World Bank staff. It is expressed in local currency units per U.S. dollar.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: International Monetary Fund, International Financial Statistics, supplemented by World Bank staff estimates.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Official exchange rate (LCU per US$, period average)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Official exchange rate refers to the exchange rate determined by national authorities or to the rate determined in the legally sanctioned exchange market. It is calculated as an annual average based on monthly averages (local currency units relative to the U.S. dollar).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: International Monetary Fund, International Financial Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: PPP conversion factor, GDP (LCU per international $)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Purchasing power parity conversion factor is the number of units of a country's currency required to buy the same amounts of goods and services in the domestic market as U.S. dollar would buy in the United States. This conversion factor is for GDP.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.

wb:indicator.wb:name: PPP conversion factor (GDP) to market exchange rate ratio
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Purchasing power parity conversion factor is the number of units of a country's currency required to buy the same amount of goods and services in the domestic market as a U.S. dollar would buy in the United States. The ratio of PPP conversion factor to market exchange rate is the result obtained by dividing the PPP conversion factor by the market exchange rate. The ratio, also referred to as the national price level, makes it possible to compare the cost of the bundle of goods that make up gross domestic product (GDP) across countries. It tells how many dollars are needed to buy a dollar's worth of goods in the country as compared to the United States.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.

wb:indicator.wb:name: PPP conversion factor, private consumption (LCU per international $)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Purchasing power parity conversion factor is the number of units of a country's currency required to buy the same amounts of goods and services in the domestic market as U.S. dollar would buy in the United States. This conversion factor is for private consumption (i.e., household final consumption expenditure).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Official exchange rate (LCU per US$, end period)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Official exchange rate refers to the exchange rate determined by national authorities or to the rate determined in the legally sanctioned exchange market. This series shows the end period value of local currency units relative to the U.S. dollar.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: International Monetary Fund, International Financial Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Real effective exchange rate is the nominal effective exchange rate (a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies) divided by a price deflator or index of costs.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: International Monetary Fund, International Financial Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Literacy rate, youth female (% of females ages 15-24)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Ratio of young literate females to males (% ages 15-24)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Ratio of young literate females to males is the percentage of females to males ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Literacy rate, youth male (% of males ages 15-24)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Literacy rate, youth total (% of people ages 15-24)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Literacy rate, adult female (% of females ages 15 and above)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Literacy rate, adult male (% of males ages 15 and above)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Literacy rate, adult total (% of people ages 15 and above)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Duration of education, compulsory
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Duration of compulsory education is the number of years that children are legally obliged to attend school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Ratio of school attendance of orphans to school attendance of non-orphans ages 10-14
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Ratio of school attendance of orphans to school attendance of non orphans is the ratio of school attendance of orphans to school attendance of non orphans ages 10-14.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Ratio of female to male primary enrollment (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Ratio of female to male primary enrollment is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Ratio of female to male secondary enrollment (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Ratio of female to male secondary enrollment is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Ratio of female to male tertiary enrollment (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Ratio of female to male tertiary enrollment is the percentage of men to women enrolled at tertiary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, preprimary (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, preprimary, female (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, preprimary, male (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary school starting age (years)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary school starting age is the age at which students would enter primary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross primary graduation ratio, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. The rate based on completers is calculated by taking the total number of completers in the last grade of primary school divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross primary graduation ratio, male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. The rate based on completers is calculated by taking the total number of completers in the last grade of primary school divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross primary graduation ratio, total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. The rate based on completers is calculated by taking the total number of completers in the last grade of primary school divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary completion rate, female (% of relevant age group)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. It is calculated by taking the total number of students in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary completion rate, male (% of relevant age group)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. It is calculated by taking the total number of students in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary completion rate, total (% of relevant age group)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. It is calculated by taking the total number of students in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Drop-out rate (%), primary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Drop outs in primary school are the students or pupils who leave school definitively in a given school year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Drop-out rate (%), primary, male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Drop outs in primary school are the students or pupils who leave school definitively in a given school year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Drop-out rate (%), primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Drop outs in primary school are the students or pupils who leave school definitively in a given school year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary education, duration (years)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary duration refers to the number of years of full-time equivalent duration in primary education in the school system according to ISCED.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary education, pupils
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Student enrollment, primary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary education, pupils (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at primary level include enrollments in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Pupil-teacher ratio, primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary school pupil-teacher ratio is the number of pupils enrolled in primary school divided by the number of primary school teachers (regardless of their teaching assignment).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary, female (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary, male (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expected primary completion rate, female (% of population at theoretical entrance age)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Expected primary completion rate is total number of new entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to complete the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expected primary completion rate, male (% of population at theoretical entrance age)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Expected primary completion rate is total number of new entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to complete the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expected primary completion rate (% of population at theoretical entrance age)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Expected primary completion rate is total number of new entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to complete the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross intake rate in grade 1, female (% of relevant age group)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross intake rate in grade 1, male (% of relevant age group)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross intake rate in grade 1, total (% of relevant age group)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary, female (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary, male (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate in grade 1, female (% of official school-age population)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate in grade 1, male (% of official school-age population)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Net intake rate in grade 1 (% of official school-age population)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, primary, private (% of total primary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Persistence to grade 5, female (% of cohort)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Persistence to grade 5 (percentage of cohort reaching grade 5) is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Persistence to grade 5, male (% of cohort)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Persistence to grade 5 (percentage of cohort reaching grade 5) is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Persistence to grade 5, total (% of cohort)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Persistence to grade 5 (percentage of cohort reaching grade 5) is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Persistence to last grade of primary, female (% of cohort)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Persistence to last grade of primary, male (% of cohort)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Persistence to last grade of primary, total (% of cohort)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters, primary, female (% of female enrollment)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters, primary, male (% of male enrollment)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters, primary, total (% of total enrollment)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Trained teachers in primary education, female (% of female teachers)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, special data collection for the Education for All Initiative.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Trained teachers in primary education, male (% of male teachers)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, special data collection for the Education for All Initiative.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Trained teachers in primary education (% of total teachers)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization, special data collection for the Education for All Initiative.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary education, teachers
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Primary education, teachers (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female teachers as a percentage of total primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Total enrollment, primary (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Total enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Total enrollment, primary, female (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Total enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Total enrollment, primary, male (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Total enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Children out of school, primary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Children out of school, primary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Children out of school, primary, male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary school starting age (years)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary school starting age is the age at which students would enter secondary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, duration (years)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary education, duration (years) is the number of grades (years) in secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Duration of education, lower secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Lower secondary duration refers to the number of years of full-time equivalent duration in lower secondary education in the school system according to ISCED.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Duration of education, upper secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Upper secondary duration refers to the number of years of full-time equivalent duration in upper secondary education in the school system according to ISCED.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, pupils
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Student enrollment, secondary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment) is the number of vocational and technical secondary level students (total, male, female) as percent of (total, male, female) secondary enrollment. Vocational and Technical education is defined as education mainly designed to lead participants to acquire the practical skills, know-how and understanding necessary for employment in a particular occupation or trade (or class of occupations or trades). Successful completion of such programmes normally leads to a labour-market relevant vocational qualification recognized by the competent authorities (e.g. Ministry of Education, employers’ associations, etc.) in the country in which it is obtained.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, pupils (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at secondary level includes enrollments in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, general pupils
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, general pupils (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment) is the number of vocational and technical secondary level students (total, male, female) as percent of (total, male, female) secondary enrollment. Vocational and Technical education is defined as education mainly designed to lead participants to acquire the practical skills, know-how and understanding necessary for employment in a particular occupation or trade (or class of occupations or trades). Successful completion of such programmes normally leads to a labour-market relevant vocational qualification recognized by the competent authorities (e.g. Ministry of Education, employers’ associations, etc.) in the country in which it is obtained.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Pupil-teacher ratio, secondary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the number of pupils enrolled in secondary school divided by the number of secondary school teachers (regardless of their teaching assignment).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, vocational pupils
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, vocational pupils (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Vocational and technical enrollment in secondary education is the percentage of secondary students enrolled in vocational education programs including teacher training, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students who are enrolled in secondary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary, female (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrollment rate (%), lower secondary, total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio, lower secondary, total is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrollment rate (%), lower secondary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio, lower secondary, female is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the female population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrollment rate (%), lower secondary, male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio, lower secondary, male is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the male population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary, male (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrollment rate (%), upper secondary, total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio, upper secondary, total is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrollment rate (%), upper secondary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio, upper secondary, female is the ratio of male enrollment, regardless of age, to the female population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross enrollment rate (%), upper secondary, male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio, upper secondary, male is the ratio of male enrollment, regardless of age, to the male population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary, female (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary, male (% net)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Net enrollment ratio is the ratio of children of official school age based on the International Standard Classification of Education 1997 who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, secondary, private (% of total secondary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Progression to secondary school, female (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Progression to secondary school, male (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Progression to secondary school (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters, secondary, female (% of female enrollment)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters, secondary, male (% of male enrollment)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Repeaters, secondary, total (% of total enrollment)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in secondary school.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, teachers (% trained), female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Trained teachers, secondary, are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, teachers (% trained), male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Trained teachers, secondary, are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, teachers (% trained)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Trained teachers, secondary, are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in their country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, teachers
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, teachers, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Secondary education, teachers (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female teachers as a percentage of total secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross tertiary graduation ratio (first degree), female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education gross graduation rate is all graduates in tertiary education expressed as a percentage of the population of the age where they theoretically finish the most common first degree programme in the given country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross tertiary graduation ratio (first degree), male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education gross graduation rate is all graduates in tertiary education expressed as a percentage of the population of the age where they theoretically finish the most common first degree programme in the given country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Gross tertiary graduation ratio (first degree), total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education gross graduation rate is all graduates in tertiary education expressed as a percentage of the population of the age where they theoretically finish the most common first degree programme in the given country.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Student enrollment, tertiary, total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at tertiary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Student enrollment, tertiary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education pupils, female is the total number of female pupils enrolled at tertiary level in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Girls enrollment share (%), tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at tertiary level includes enrollments in public and private schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, tertiary (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, tertiary, female (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: School enrollment, tertiary, male (% gross)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates, tertiary, total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates, tertiary, total is the number of graduates from tertiary schools.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in agriculture, female (% of total female graduates, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in agriculture (% of total graduates, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates, tertiary, female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in agriculture (%, tertiary)

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in education (%, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates in the given field of education, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates in the given field of education from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in engineering, manufacturing and construction (%, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates in the given field of education, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates in the given field of education from tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in health (%, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates in the given field of education, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates in the given field of education from tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in humanities and arts (%, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates in the given field of education, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates in the given field of education from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in science (%, tertiary)

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates in the given field of education, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates in the given field of education from tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female share of graduates in services (%, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female share of graduates in the given field of education, tertiary is the number of female graduates expressed as a percentage of the total number of graduates in the given field of education from tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Girls graduates share (%), tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in health, female (% of total female graduates, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in humanities and arts, female (% of total female graduates, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in humanities and arts (% of total graduates, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in unknown or unspecified fields (% of total graduates, tertiary)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Graduates in social science, business, law (% of total graduates, tertiary)

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.

wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Graduates by fields of education, tertiary, is the share of all graduates in the given field of education, from tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Private enrollment share (%), tertiary
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Tertiary education, teachers
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education, teachers is the number of teachers in tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Tertiary education, teachers (% female)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Tertiary education, teachers (% female) is the share of female teachers in tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public current education expenditure, primary (% of current education expenditure)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public current expenditure in primary as the share of public current educational expenditure is the share of public current expenditure on education that is devoted to primary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public current education expenditure, secondary (% of current education expenditure)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public current expenditure in secondary as the share of public current educational expenditure is the share of public current expenditure on education that is devoted to secondary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public current education expenditure, tertiary (% of current education expenditure)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public current expenditure in tertiary as the share of public current educational expenditure is the share of public current expenditure on education that is devoted to tertiary education.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public current education expenditure (% of total education expenditure)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public current expenditure on education , total is the public current expenditure as a percentage of total public expenditure on education (current and capital) in a given financial year.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expenditure per student, primary (% of GDP per capita)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per capita. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expenditure per student, secondary (% of GDP per capita)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per capita. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Expenditure per student, tertiary (% of GDP per capita)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per capita. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Share of expenditure for tertiary education (% of total education expenditure)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Share of public expenditure for tertiary education is the percentage of public education expenditure for tertiary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public spending on education, total (% of government expenditure)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public expenditure on education consists of current and capital public expenditure on education includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public spending on education, total (% of GDP)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public expenditure on education consists of current and capital public expenditure on education includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public education expenditure, % of GNI
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public spending on education, total is the public expenditure on education as % of GNI. The public expenditure on education consists of current and capital public expenditure on education includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Public education expenditure per student (% of p.c. GDP), all levels
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students, as a percentage of GDP per capita. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Average years of schooling of adults (aged 15+), female
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Average years of schooling are the years of formal schooling received, on average, by youths and adults ages 15+
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Average years of schooling of adults (aged 15+), male
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Average years of schooling are the years of formal schooling received, on average, by youths and adults ages 15+
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Average years of schooling of adults (aged 15+), total
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Average years of schooling are the years of formal schooling received, on average, by youths and adults ages 15+
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

wb:indicator.wb:name: Women's access to land (0=no restriction to 1=full restriction)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Women's access to land is an index that indicates whether women are allowed to and can de facto have access to land. In all cases, the variables are between 0 and 1. The value 0 means no or very low inequality and the value 1 indicates high inequality.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: Gender, Institutions and Development Database, Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), web site: http://www.oecd.org/document/16/0,3343,en_2649_33935_39323280_1_1_1_1,00.html.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Women's access to bank loans (0=no restriction to 1=full restriction)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Women's access to bank loans is an index that indicates whether women are allowed to and can de facto have access to bank loans. In all cases, the variables are between 0 and 1. The value 0 means no or very low inequality and the value 1 indicates high inequality.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: Gender, Institutions and Development Database, Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), web site: http://www.oecd.org/document/16/0,3343,en_2649_33935_39323280_1_1_1_1,00.html.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Women's access to property other than land (0=no restriction to 1=full restriction)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Women's access to property other than land is an index that indicates whether women are allowed to and can de facto have access to other property. This indicator primarily measures access to real property such as houses, but could also cover any other type of immovable property. In all cases, the variables are between 0 and 1. The value 0 means no or very low inequality and the value 1 indicates high inequality.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: Gender, Institutions and Development Database, Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), web site: http://www.oecd.org/document/16/0,3343,en_2649_33935_39323280_1_1_1_1,00.html.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Proportion of women in ministerial level positions (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Women in ministerial level positions is the number of women in ministerial or equivalent positions in the government.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nation's, World's Women.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Women in parliaments are the percentage of parliamentary seats in a single or lower chamber held by women.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: United Nations, Women's Indicators and Statistics database (www.ipu.org).

wb:indicator.wb:name: Female professional and technical workers (% of total)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Female professional and technical workers refers to the share of professionals and technical workers who are female. Women's share of positions are defined according to the International Standard Classification of Occupations (ISCO-88) to include physical, mathematical and engineering science professionals (and associate professionals), life science and health professionals (and associate professionals), teaching professionals (and associate professionals) and other professionals and associate professionals.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: Gender, Institutions and Development Database, Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), web site: http://www.oecd.org/document/16/0,3343,en_2649_33935_39323280_1_1_1_1,00.html.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Wage equality between women and men for similar work (ratio)
wb:indicator.wb:sourceNote: Wage equality between women and men for similar work refers to the ratio of female to male wages for similar work in nonagricultural sectors.
wb:indicator.wb:sourceOrganization: The Global Gender Gap report from the World Economic Forum, Executive Opinion Survey 2007.

wb:indicator.wb:name: Inpatient admission rate (% of population )
